variant.name: .Android
variant.summary: The password is for an Android app.

variant.name: .Ftp
variant.summary: The scheme of the origin is FTP.

variant.name: .Http
variant.summary: The scheme of the origin is HTTP.

variant.name: .Https
variant.summary: The scheme of the origin is HTTPS.

variant.name: .Other
variant.summary: The scheme of the origin is something else.

variant.name: InitialMigrationForSyncUsers
variant.summary: migrating passwords from build-in backend to android backend for sync users after enrolling into the UPM experiment

variant.name: MigrationForLocalUsers
variant.summary: migrating passwords between android backend and build-in backend to ensure consistency for local users

variant.name: NonSyncableDataMigrationToAndroidBackend
variant.summary: migrating non-syncable data to the android backend when password sync gets enabled

variant.name: NonSyncableDataMigrationToBuiltInBackend
variant.summary: migrating non-syncable data to the built-in backend when password sync gets disabled

variant.name: ReenrollmentAttemptMigration
variant.summary: migrating non-syncable data to the android backend when performing reenrollment possibility check

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryActionImpression
histogram.summary: Android only. Records whenever users faces an action in the accessory bar or one of its sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryActionSelected
histogram.summary: Android only. Records whenever users select an action in the accessory bar or one of its sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryBarShown
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often users encounter the keyboard accessory bar. Its buckets show the contents when it came up. Every bucket may be logged up to one time per impression.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetSuggestionCount
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how many suggestions a user faced when opening a sheet. The base histogram counts impressions across all sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetSuggestionsSelected
histogram.summary: Android only. Records which type of suggestion was selected from an open sheet.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetTriggered
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the bottom sheet was opened or closed by a user and the overall count of closures. Closing buckets may be logged up to one time per trigger. There are suffixes for each specific sheet type.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryToggleClicked
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the user clicks on a certain toggle when opening an accessory sheet together with the state the toggle was in before clicking.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryToggleImpression
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the user sees a certain toggle when opening an accessory sheet together with the state the toggle was in.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.DisabledSavingAccessoryImpressions
histogram.summary:
Android only. Records the number of times that the keyboard accessory was shown on a form for which saving is disabled (with a crossed-out key icon). Recorded when the user focuses the password field.
Note: Only the "Shown" bucket should contain samples.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.GenerationDialogChoice.{GenerationType}
histogram.summary: Android only. Records the interactions with the password generation dialog for {GenerationType}. Recorded when the user taps a button in the dialog or dismsses it.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.BiometricAuthenticationPromo.AcceptClicked
histogram.summary: Records whether user clicked accept button on the Biometric Authentication before filling promo dialog. Recorded when the dialog is closed.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.CompromisedBubble.CheckClicked
histogram.summary: Whether the user proceeded to the list of the left compromised passwords from the bubble following save/update password.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.CompromisedBubble.Type
histogram.summary: The state of the bubble shown after users saves/updates a password. It notifies the user about leftover compromised passwords.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.DisplayDisposition
histogram.summary: When the password management bubble opened, what state was it in?

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.Event
histogram.summary:
Measures the frequency of various password generation events.
Note that this histogram is logged from the renderer process, and consequently the numbers should not be directly compared to the other PasswordGeneration.* histograms, which are logged from the browser process. Histograms logged in different processes are lost at different rates, which introduces systematic bias between histograms logged in the renderer process vs. those logged in the browser process.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.GeneratedPasswordWasEdited
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of user editing of generated passwords. Uploaded once per generated password save. Applicable to automatic and manual generations.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.PopupShown
histogram.summary: Records an entry if (and only if) a popup was shown.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.SubmissionAvailableEvent
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of submission events for passwords that could have been generated, but the user didn't choose to use the feature. This is to compare with PasswordGeneration.SubmssionEvent.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.SubmissionEvent
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of submission events for generated passwords. This is similar to PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl but only tracks events which are interesting for generated passwords.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.UploadStarted
histogram.summary: The number of times that we try to upload a form that we believe should trigger password generation. False means that something about the form would not allow us to try upload (not an Autofillable field, uploading disabled, Autofill servers in backoff, etc.). True does not mean that the upload actually completed successfully, just that it was started.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.UserDecision
histogram.summary: Records user-triggered events related to a generated password. Only the last occurring event is logged. The recording takes place when the password form is destroyed.

histogram.name: PasswordHash.CreateTime
histogram.summary: Time required to create the local hash of the user's GAIA password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AbleToSavePasswordsOnSuccessfulLogin
histogram.summary: Records attempts to prompt user to save a password when password store is not ready for saving passwords due to an initialization error. Recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AcceptedSaveUpdateSubmissionIndicatorEvent
histogram.summary: The type of event that the Password Manager used for detecting a password form submission when saving or updating a password. Recorded each time a user accepts a password save/update prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccessPasswordInSettings
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user accesses the passwords in the settings page.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogMultipleAccounts
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser with multiple accounts. Recorded when the account chooser is dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogOneAccount
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser with one account. Recorded when the account chooser is dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.ClearedOnStartup
histogram.summary: Records whether the account-scoped password storage had to be cleared during profile initialization.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.ClearedOptInForAllAccounts
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the opt-in for the account-scoped password storage is cleared for all Google Accounts. This typically happens because the signin cookies were cleared. The recorded value is the number of opt-ins that were cleared.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.MoveToAccountStoreFlowAccepted
histogram.summary: When the user accepts to move a password from the profile store to the account store, this records what user action caused the moving flow to be offered. If the flow is offered but rejected by the user, the histogram is not recorded. Recorded only in Win/Mac/Linux.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.MoveToAccountStoreFlowOffered
histogram.summary: When the user is offered to move a password from the profile store to the account store, this records what user action caused the moving flow to be offered. Recorded only in Win/Mac/Linux.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.NumOptedInAccountsAfterOptIn
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user opts in to the account-scoped password storage. The recorded value is the total number of opted-in accounts in this profile, including the new opt-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.NumOptedInAccountsAfterOptOut
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user opts out of the account-scoped password storage. The recorded value is the total number of opted-in accounts remaining in this profile after the current opt-out.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorage.UnsyncedPasswordsFoundDuringSignOut
histogram.summary: Records how many passwords in the account store were unsynced when the user signed out of their Google Account. Recorded only in Win/Mac/Linux when a user of the account-scoped password storage signs out.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStorageUserStateDuration
histogram.summary:
The amount of active browsing time that was spent in different user states related to the PasswordManager's account-scoped storage.
This time is measured from when the user starts interacting with the browser until either they stopped interacting with the browser (as determined by DesktopSessionDurationTracker) or their user state changes. These end-points are when the metric is emitted.
Because a duration can end either because the user became inactive or because their status changed, the distribution of individual durations measured are unlikely to be helpful. Instead, please compare total durations.
This metric is only recorded on Win/Mac/Linux.
Note: As part of crbug/1223007, we discovered that histogram PasswordManager.AccountStorageUserStateDuration.SignedOutUser was recorded for Guest and System profiles which wasn't intentional. This was fixed in M93.
One caveat with this metric is that if the user has multiple profiles open at the same time, their session activity will be logged from all the profiles, instead of only from the profile that the user is using at that moment.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStoreBlocklistedEntriesAfterOptIn
histogram.summary: Records how many blocklisting entries are downloaded to the account store after unlocking account store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStoreCredentialsAfterOptIn
histogram.summary: Records how many non-blacklisting credentials are downloaded to the account store after unlocking account store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountStoreVsProfileStore3.{DifferenceType}
histogram.summary: The number of accounts {DifferenceType}. Recorded once per Chrome profile, soon after startup, only for users who are opted in to the account-scoped storage. Recorded at most once per day.

variant.name: Additional
variant.summary: stored in the password manager's account-scoped store that don't exist in the profile-scoped store

variant.name: Conflicting
variant.summary: stored in the password manager with a conflicting password between the account-scoped store and profile-scoped store (i.e. the signon realm and username match, but the password does not)

variant.name: Identical
variant.summary: stored in both the password manager's account-scoped store and profile-scoped store

variant.name: Missing
variant.summary: stored in the password manager's profile-scoped store that don't exist in the account-scoped store

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AddCredentialFromSettings.AccountStoreUsed
histogram.summary: Tracks which store is used when the user adds a new credential from Settings. True means account store, false means device store. Recorded only for users who opted in for account storage and thus are given a choice. Only applicable to Desktop platform.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AddCredentialFromSettings.UserAction
histogram.summary: Records the user actions performed when a new credential is added from Settings. Only applicable to Desktop and iOS platforms.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.FetchSize
histogram.summary: The number of facets for which affiliation information was requested in a network fetch. Recorded for each network fetch. Warning: this histogram was expired from M90 to M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.FirstFetchDelay
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between creation of the AffiliationBackend and the first time it needed to issue a network fetch. Warning: this histogram was expired from M90 to M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.SubsequentFetchDelay
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between subsequent network fetches. Recorded whenever the AffiliationBackend initiated a network fetch, regardless of success or failure. Warning: this histogram was expired from M90 to M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FailedToParseResponse
histogram.summary: Recorded only when serialized response from the Affiliation Service can't be parsed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchErrorCode
histogram.summary: The network error code, as reported by the underlying URLFetcher. Recorded only for each network fetch that failed due to network/server errors. Warning: this histogram was expired from M90 to M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchHttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code, as reported by the underlying URLFetcher. Recorded only for each network fetch that failed due to network/server errors. Warning: this histogram was expired from M90 to M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Whether the network fetch succeeded, failed due to network/server errors, or contained malformed data. Recorded for each network fetch.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchTime.{Status}
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between sending a request to AffiliationService and receiving a response. Recorded only when request {Status}.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.ResponseSize.{Status}
histogram.summary: The size of an affiliation service hash lookup response in bytes. Recorded only when request {Status}.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationService.GetChangePasswordUsage
histogram.summary: Usage and timing of the Affiliation Service GetChangePasswordUrl call.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AliveAfter{ErrorCode}Error
histogram.summary: Recorded after PasswordStore GMS Core backend returned with {ErrorCode} error. The first status is reported right after receiving the error, the second one is reported with a 10 seconds delay indicating if Chrome didn't shutdown/restart soon after receiving this error. Note that the second status could also be not reported if Chrome is sent to background.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ApplySyncChanges.AddLoginSyncError
histogram.summary: Records different results upon adding a remote password to the password manager. It is recorded every time after receiving remote password incremental updates from the server.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ApplySyncChanges.UpdateLoginSyncError
histogram.summary: Records different results upon updating a remote password to the password manager. It is recorded every time after receiving remote password incremental updates from the server.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ApplySyncChangesState
histogram.summary: Records different states upon applying remote sync changes to the password manager. It recorded every time after receiving remote password incremental updates from the server.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutomaticChange.AcceptanceWithAutoButton
histogram.summary: Resolution action to fix a compromised credential when there is a "Change password automatically" button.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutomaticChange.AcceptanceWithoutAutoButton
histogram.summary: Resolution action to fix a compromised credential when there is no "Change password automatically" button.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutomaticChange.AssistantStoppedBubbleCloseReason
histogram.summary: The reason why the "Assistant stopped" bubble was closed. The bubble is shown when an automatic password change flow on Desktop is ended prematurely.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutomaticChange.ForSitesWithScripts
histogram.summary: Resolution action to fix a compromised credential when there is a password change script for the credential's domain. The metric is reported also if the automated password change feature is disabled.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutoSigninFirstRunDialog
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the auto-signin first run experience.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BiometricAuthBeforeFillingEnabled
histogram.summary: Indicates whether biometric authentication before filling is enabled. Recorded 30 seconds after PasswordStore is created which happens once per profile, and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BiometricAuthPwdFill.AuthResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to re-auth the user via biometrics when filling a password or signing in from the account chooser dialog. From M97, CancelledByChrome is recorded when the auth is cancelled and before the auth result actually returns.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BiometricAuthPwdFill.CanAuthenticate
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a password filling surface or the account chooser dialog checks whether it can use biometrics to re-authenticate the user.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BubbleSuppression.AccountsInStatisticsTable
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in password_manager::StatisticsTable. These are accounts for which the user ignored the save bubble at least once. The count is recorded once per browser start-up. (In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile that first has a WebContents created.)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.CanceledTime
histogram.summary: The time the password bulk check was running until canceled by the user.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.CheckedCredentials
histogram.summary: Count of credentials analyzed when the password bulk check completed successfully (see '.CheckedCredentialsOnErrorOrCanceled' for non-success cases). Note that this counts unique username+password pairs, so in the case of password reuse, this does not correspond to the number of user-visible credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.CheckedCredentialsOnErrorOrCanceled
histogram.summary: Count of credentials that were supposed to be analyzed if the password bulk check encountered an error or was canceled (see '.CheckedCredentials' for the success case). Note that this counts unique username+password pairs, so in the case of password reuse, this does not correspond to the number of user-visible credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.CompromisedCredentialsCountAfterCheckAndroid
histogram.summary: Count of compromised credentials shown in the UI, recorded whenever a bulk leak check finished successfully. As opposed to 'BulkCheck.LeaksFound', this metric includes duplicates (i.e. same username+password pair saved for multiple domains), and it also includes other types of compromised credentials (e.g. phished).

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.CompromisedCredentialsCountWithAutoChangeAfterCheckAndroid
histogram.summary: Count of compromised credentials that have a 'Change automatically' button, recorded whenever a bulk leak check finished successfully. Should be compared to 'CompromisedCredentialsCountAfterCheckAndroid'.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.Error
histogram.summary: Error encountered during the password bulk check.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.LeaksFound
histogram.summary: Count of leaked credentials found when the password bulk check completed successfully. Note that this counts unique username+password pairs, so in the case of password reuse, this does not correspond to the number of user-visible credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.PasswordCheckReferrer
histogram.summary: Referrer of a navigation to the Password Check page. Recorded when the user visits the Password Check settings page, either via native or Web UI.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.PasswordCheckReferrerAndroid2
histogram.summary: Referrer of a navigation to the Password Check UI Settings view. Recorded when the user enters the view. Replaces PasswordManager.BulkCheck.PasswordCheckReferrerAndroid histogram. Fixing the bug that LEAK_DIALOG entry was reported as PHISHED_WARNING_DIALOG with UPM enabled.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.ScriptsCacheState
histogram.summary: The state of the scripts cache for automatic password changed that is encountered on opening the password check subpage on Desktop and the UI reaction to it.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.Time
histogram.summary: The time it took for the password bulk check to complete successfully.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.TimePerCredential
histogram.summary: The average time per credential when the password bulk check completed successfully.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.UserAction
histogram.summary: User actions performed on the Password Check settings page.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BulkCheck.UserActionAndroid
histogram.summary: User actions performed on the Password Check settings view.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CanUseBiometricsMac
histogram.summary: If user have enabled biometric authentication on their device. It is recorded whenever BiometricAuthenticatorMac::CanAuthenticate is called.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CapabilitiesService.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response code of fetching domains' password change capabilities.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CertificateErrorsWhileSeeingForms
histogram.summary: When the password manager sees new forms on the page, it records in this histogram whether there were any SSL certificate errors. The presence of SSL errors likely means that the password manger will stop working, so the reporting is done at the last point when password manager is still guaranteed to be active. Some particular errors are distinguished, with the rest being reported in a catch-all bucket.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CleanedUpPasswords
histogram.summary: Collects positive number of undecryptable passwords that were successfully deleted when syncing was enabled. Recorded for sync users for each profile if there is at least one password deleted when merging logins from Sync and local database.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CompromisedCredentials2.{Issue}
histogram.summary: Count of known {Issue}. Recorded once per Chrome profile at most once per day.

variant.name: CountLeakedAfterBulkCheck
variant.summary: leaked credentials in the database if password bulk check was executed at least once

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialEditError
histogram.summary: Records the errors displayed by the saved credential entry editor, when the user encounters them. Android-only for now.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialEntryActions.{CredentialEntryType}
histogram.summary: Records actions performed by the users in the {CredentialEntryType} view. Android-only for now.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialManager.{ProfileType}.GetIntent.Error
histogram.summary: Records the error encountered while attempting to fetch the Credential Manager launch intent from Google Play Services for the {ProfileType}. This is recorded either before making the actual request (if the preconditions are not met) or after the asynchronous call comes back with an error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialManager.{ProfileType}.GetIntent.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the time(ms) elapsed between asking Google Play Services for the intent used to open the Credential Manager for the {ProfileType} and receiving it. It includes synchronous calls made to get the CredentialManagerClient. Recorded when the asynchronous call comes back and only on success.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialManager.{ProfileType}.GetIntent.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether fetching the Credential Manager launch intent from Google Play Services for the {ProfileType} was successful or not. Recorded when the asynchronous call comes back.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialManager.{ProfileType}.Launch.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether the provided intent to launch the Credential Manager for the {ProfileType} could be used successfully. This is recorded right after calling send() on the intent which happens when the async call to get the intent from Google Play Services returns. Metric will not be reported when the Loading dialog is cancelled by user or timed out.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialsCountFromAccountStoreAfterUnlock
histogram.summary: Recorded after unlocking the account store from the password filling flow. Records how many credentials from the account store can be used to fill the current password form. If a credential is an exact duplicate with a local credential, it still counts into this metric.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialsWithDuplicates2
histogram.summary: The number of stored (non-blacklisted) credentials for which "duplicates" exist. A duplicate is a credential with the same signon realm, username, and password - i.e. indistinguishable from the user's point of view. This records the number of *sets* of duplicated credentials; the number of credentials in each set of duplicates is not recorded. Recorded once per Chrome profile at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.CredentialsWithMismatchedDuplicates2
histogram.summary: The number of stored (non-blacklisted) credentials for which "mismatched duplicates" exist. A mismatched duplicate is a credential with the same signon realm and username, but different password. This records the number of *sets* of duplicated credentials; the number of credentials in each set of duplicates is not recorded. Recorded once per Chrome profile at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.DefaultPasswordStoreSet
histogram.summary: The default store for newly-saved passwords (profile-scoped store or account-scoped store), recorded whenever it is set explicitly.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.DeleteUndecryptableLoginsReturnValue
histogram.summary: Records the return value of the DeleteUndecryptableLogins method in the LoginDatabase class. Called for sync user and for each profile when merging logins from Sync and local database.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.DropdownShown.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records availability of password manager suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.DynamicFormChanges
histogram.summary: Records a bitmask of password form changes after the first time this form is seen by Password Manager. Recorded once per a form when the form is removed from DOM. Bit 0 - changes in number of fields, bit 1 - changes in fields renderer ids, bit 2 - changes in autocomplete attributes, bit 3 - changes in form control types, bit 4 - changes in field names.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EditsInSaveBubble
histogram.summary: Indication whether users change the credentials (username and password) in the save bubble of the password manager, considering only cases where the user saves a new credential or updates a credential.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Enabled3
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the password manager is enabled. Recorded 30 seconds after PasswordStore is created which happens once per profile, and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ErrorMessageDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that caused the Password Manager error message on Android to be dismissed. It's recorded when the user dismisses the message by clicking the Sign in button or when the message is autodismissed because of the timeout.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ErrorMessageDisplayReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that caused the Password Manager error message to be displayed. It's recorded as soon as the message is created and the recorded reason is the error type. Currently only used on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FieldNameCollisionInVotes
histogram.summary: Measures whether a password vote had a field name collision, i.e. multiple fields that should have an Autofill type uploaded have the same name.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FilledCredentialWasFromAndroidApp
histogram.summary: When a credential is filled, whether it comes from an Android app.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FillingAssistance
histogram.summary:
This metric records the user experience with regards to passwords filling. It is only recorded on password form submissions that are considered to be successful.
The first 4 buckets (0..3) are ranging from the best filling behavior (automatic filling on page load without user interaction necessary) to the worst (the user had to manually type a password that was already saved).
The following buckets (4..5) indicate cases when it was impossible to fill credentials because unknown credentials were submitted, meaning that the submitted password was not saved before.
The last bucket (6) corresponds to the strange cases, where the submitted form has neither user input nor autofilled data in password fields. This might indicate third-party password manager use, or might be a measurement/submission classification error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FillingSource
histogram.summary: This metric records the source of filled passwords: The profile-scoped store, the account-scoped store, both of them, or none of them (if the user typed the password manually). It is only recorded on password form submissions that are considered to be successful.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FillingSuccessIOS
histogram.summary: This metric records whether filling was successful or not on IOS. The metric is recorded when filling upon suggestion click or on page load.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FillSuggestionsIncludeAndroidAppCredentials
histogram.summary: When offering to fill the username and password, whether at least one of the credentials in the dropdown comes from an Android app.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FirstRendererFillingResult
histogram.summary:
Records whether the PasswordAutofillAgent in the renderer manages to fill credentials as instructed by the browser or records a failure reason otherwise. Only the outcome of the first attempt to fill is recorded.
This is replicated as PasswordForm.Fill.FirstFillingResultInRenderer in UKM.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FirstWaitForUsernameReason
histogram.summary:
This metric records why the browser instructs the renderer not to fill the credentials on page load but to wait for the user to confirm the credential to be filled. Only the value of the first decision to fill is recorded.
This is replicated as PasswordForm.Fill.FirstWaitForUsernameReason in UKM.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FormDataDeserializationStatus
histogram.summary: The success or failure of deserializing saved FormData. Failure either indicates corrupted data or the presence of bugs in the serialization or deserialization code.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FormSubmission.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: This histogram records the browser profile type when a password form is submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FormVisited.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: This histogram records the browser profile type when a password form is visited. This is recorded once for each frame.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GeneratedFormHasNoFormManager
histogram.summary: When the generation state of a password was changed, records whether an existing form corresponding to the password was found.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpCredentials
histogram.summary: Breakdown of HTTP credentials with regard to the existence of a HTTPS credential with the same username and whether the corresponding website has HSTS enabled. Recorded once for each HTTP credential of the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpPasswordMigrationCount
histogram.summary: Number of HTTP saved passwords that were migrated to HTTPS. Recorded on HTTPS password form load when there are no credentials saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpPasswordMigrationMode
histogram.summary: The mode of migration applied to HTTP passwords migrating to HTTPS. Recorded on HTTPS password form load when there are no credentials saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Import.DesktopInteractions
histogram.summary: Records the user actions related to passwords import flow on desktop. Reported upon interactions with the password settings page.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to import credentials in passwords import flow. The time that is tracked is the time needed to process the credentials, checking for conflicts, generating status and storing them. This metric doesn't include the time needed to read the CSV file. Recorded when the import flow finished importing all credentials within password settings.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportedPasswordsPerUserInCSV
histogram.summary: The number of passwords imported in CSV format per user. Recorded when the user imports passwords within the password settings.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportEntryStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the individual status of a single password entry from the provided CSV File after it has been processed in the Passwords Import flow in settings UI. Recorded when a single entry has been processed and checked for errors or missing fields. Recording occurs within password settings.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportFileSize
histogram.summary: The size of the CSV file (to import passwords from) selected by a user in bytes. Recorded when the user tries to import passwords from a CSV file. The user has chosen the file, but the file hasn't been read yet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportResultsStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the final outcome status of importing a CSV File to Chrome Password Manager in settings UI. Recorded when the import flow finishes within password settings. This can be either successfuly or due to an error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.iOS.InfoBar.PasswordSave
histogram.summary: This metric counts how many times the Save Password infobar is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.iOS.PasswordDetails.CopyDetailsFailed
histogram.summary: This metric counts how many times we fail to copy a field in the Passwords Details to the pastboard. Only the true bucket is logged. See crbug.com/1359331.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.IsSyncPasswordHashSaved
histogram.summary: This metric reports whether a sync password hash is saved. Recorded shortly after Chrome startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.IsSyncPasswordHashSavedForAdvancedProtectionUser
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded shortly after Chrome Startup, only for Advanced Protection users. This is a subset of PasswordManager.IsSyncPasswordHashSaved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ItemSelected.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records selection of password manager suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.JavaScriptOnlyValueInSubmittedForm
histogram.summary: Records whether a successfully submitted password form has only values that came from JavaScript.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.AnalyzeSingleLeakResponseResult
histogram.summary: Result of analyzing a single leak response.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.DialogDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Reason of the dismissal of the leak detection dialog. Recorded when a leaked credential is detected and the dialog is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.Error
histogram.summary: Shows the error that happened in password leak detection on sign-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response code of a leak lookup request. Only recoded for each network fetch that failed due to network/server errors.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.IsPasswordReused
histogram.summary: When a password is determined as leaked, records if it's saved for other sites.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.IsPasswordSaved
histogram.summary: When a password is determined as leaked, records if it's saved in Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.LookupSingleLeakResponseResult
histogram.summary: Whether the network fetch succeeded, failed due to network/server errors, or contained malformed data. Recorded for each leak lookup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.NotifyIsLeakedTime
histogram.summary: The time it took from starting a leak check to notifying the user about a leak.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.ObtainAccessTokenTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to obtain an access token for an authenticated leak lookup request.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.ReceiveSingleLeakResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to receive a server response after issuing a request for a single leak lookup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.SingleLeakResponsePrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of matched prefixes in a single leak lookup response. Only recorded if the network response was wellformed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LeakDetection.SingleLeakResponseSize
histogram.summary: The size of a single leak lookup response in bytes. Only recorded if there was no network or server error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LoginDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: An error on LoginDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ManagePasswordsReferrer
histogram.summary: Referrer of a navigation to the "Manage Passwords" page. Recorded when the user attempts to see their list of passwords, either via native or Web UI.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MatchedFormType
histogram.summary: This metric records the type of the preferred password for filling. It is recorded when the browser instructs the renderer to fill the credentials on page load.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationOptional
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="optional". That is the result of account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationRequired
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="required". That is the result of forced account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationSilent
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="silent". That is the result of auto sign-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MergeSyncData.AddLoginSyncError
histogram.summary: Records different results upon adding a remote password to the password manager. It is recorded during the initial sync when merging remote and local data.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MergeSyncData.UpdateLoginSyncError
histogram.summary: Records different results upon updating a remote password in the password manager. It is recorded during the initial sync when merging remote and local data.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MigratedSettingsUPMAndroid
histogram.summary: Records true when a settings migration occurs as part of the UPM transition. It is recorded when the settings service (profile-scoped) is instantiated in a Chrome client with UPM enabled if a migration hasn't already occured. Note that if UPM is disabled, the next time it is enabled a new migration will happen and be recorded.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ModalLoadingDialog.{IntentType}.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the GMS Core UI loading dialog shown when the user launches the {IntentType}. Recorded for both successful and failed attempts to get and launch the {IntentType}. The outcome is recorded right before attempting to send the {IntentType} PendingIntent.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MoveUIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the "move password to account?" bubble closed? Recorded whenever the bubble is closed, either because the user clicked one of the buttons or it went away automatically (lost focus).

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NewlySavedPasswordHasEmptyUsername.{PasswordType}
histogram.summary: Whether a newly saved password has an empty username. Recorded right before a new credential is commited to the store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NewlySavedPasswordIsGenerated
histogram.summary: For a newly saved password, whether the password was generated by Chrome or typed manually by the user.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NonSyncPasswordHashChange
histogram.summary: This metric reports a type of a password hash change event where the associated account is not syncing. Recorded when a non sync password hash is saved or cleared.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordChangeFlowDuration{EntryPoint}{StartEvent}{EndEvent}
histogram.summary: Duration of a password change flow {EntryPoint} {StartEvent} {EndEvent}.

variant.name: .LeakCheckInSettings
variant.summary: that was triggered from a leak check

variant.name: .LeakWarningDialog
variant.summary: that was triggered from a leak warning dialog

variant.name: .AutomatedFlow
variant.summary: as an automated change password flow

variant.name: .ManualFlow
variant.summary: as a manual change password flow

variant.name: .ManualResetLinkFlow
variant.summary: as a manual password reset link flow

variant.name: .AutomatedFlowPasswordChosen
variant.summary: and ended with a password from an automated flow

variant.name: .AutomatedFlowResetLinkRequested
variant.summary: and ended with the request of a password reset link

variant.name: .ManualFlowPasswordChosen
variant.summary: and ended with a password from a manual flow

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.Launch.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether the provided intent to launch the Password Checkup could be used successfully. This is recorded right after calling send() on the intent which happens when the async call to get the intent from Google Play Services returns. Metric will not be reported when the Loading dialog is cancelled by user or timed out.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.{Operation}.APIError
histogram.summary: Records the error code returned by the GMS Password Checkup 1P API while attempting to {Operation}. This is recorded after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is only recorded for GMS API errors on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.{Operation}.Error
histogram.summary: Records the backend error code encountered while attempting to {Operation}. If the code is equal to 2 (API_ERROR), GMS 1P API error code is additionally reported. This is recorded either before making the actual request (if the preconditions are not met) or after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.{Operation}.ErrorLatency
histogram.summary: Records the time(ms) elapsed between asking Google Play Services to {Operation} and receiving the error response. This is recorded either before making the actual request (if the preconditions are not met) or after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.{Operation}.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the time(ms) elapsed between asking Google Play Services to {Operation} and receiving the response. It includes synchronous calls made to get the PasswordCheckupClient. Recorded when the asynchronous call comes back and only on success. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordCheckup.{Operation}.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether attempt to {Operation} using the Google Play Services was successful or not. Recorded when the asynchronous call comes back.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordDropdownItemSelected
histogram.summary: Logs the type of the suggestion in the password dropdown when selected.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordDropdownShown
histogram.summary: Logs the state of the password dropdown when it's shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordEditUpdatedValues
histogram.summary: This metric shows what exactly users change in the password edit dialog: nothing, username, password or both.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordExport.Event
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various password export events in settings menu. Recorded when the user interacts with the password export menu item or dialog. Curently logged only on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordNoteActionInSettings
histogram.summary: This metric shows how user created / edited / cleared the note field in the passwords settings page. Recorded after closing the add/edit password dialog in settings.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.NumberOfMatches
histogram.summary:
This metric shows how many saved credentials (num unique registry-controlled domains) have password that's equal to the reused password.
Before M63 this logged a "0" for sync-reuse.
A "password reuse" is when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain or is equal to the sync password on a non google-login domain.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.PasswordFieldDetected
histogram.summary:
This metric reports whether a password field had been detected on a page when a password reuse happened.
A "password reuse" is when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain or is equal to the sync password on a non google-login domain.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.TotalPasswords
histogram.summary:
This metric shows how many credentials are stored in Password Manager when a password reuse happened. This counts unique registry-controlled domains with passwords saved.
A "password reuse" is when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain or is equal to the sync password on a non google-login domain.
During M61/M62 this metric logged a "1" for every sync-reuse. It was fixed in M63 such that it logs actual Password Manager credential count.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordScriptsFetcher.CacheState
histogram.summary: PasswordScriptsFetcher's cache state when the fetcher is requested to return script availability.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordScriptsFetcher.HttpResponseAndNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response code or network error code of fetching a list of available password scripts.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordScriptsFetcher.ParsingResult
histogram.summary: Result of parsing of a list of available password scripts.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordScriptsFetcher.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: Response time for fetching a list of available password scripts.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.APIError1
histogram.summary:
The error codes returned by the GMS Core Password preferences 1P API while attempting to {Function} for {Setting}. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned. This is currently only recorded on Android.
Replacing PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.APIError which incorrectly recorded *only* the enum values and crashed for all unknown values.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records the error encountered in PasswordSettingsUpdater while attempting to {Function} for {Setting}. This is recorded either before making the actual request (if the preconditions are not met) or after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.ErrorLatency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of the asynchronous attempt to {Function} for {Setting}. Recorded when the asynchronous job failed. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.Latency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of the asynchronous attempt to {Function} for {Setting}. Only recorded when the asynchronous job has returned successfully. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSettings.{Function}.{Setting}.Success
PasswordManager.PasswordStore.OnLoginsChanged
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever PasswordStore notifies consumers about changes to logins. Changes can be made locally (in settings, in bubbles etc.) or remotely (via sync). Records only true.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore.OnLoginsRetained
histogram.summary: Android only. |OnLoginsRetained| replaces |OnLoginsChanged| and this metric records potential calls of |OnLoginsRetained| to measure differences in volume after switching. The metrics is recorded whenever the PasswordStore (potentially) requests all logins to notify consumers because data may have changed. Changes can occur within Chrome (e.g. after saving/updating a password) or externally.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore.TimesAttemptedToReenrollInUPM
histogram.summary: Recorded on Android when the password store backend is created. This happens on startup and once per profile, only for users in the UPM experiment. Users can be unenrolled from UPM after encountering errors in communication with the backend and reenrolled back if the backend communication is considered reliable again. Records the number of times the user has attempted to automatically reenroll in Google Mobile Services.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore.TimesReenrolledInUPM
histogram.summary: Recorded on Android when the password store backend is created. This happens on startup and once per profile, only for users in the UPM experiment. Users can be unenrolled from UPM after encountering errors in communication with the backend and reenrolled back if the backend communication is considered reliable again. Records the number of times the user was reenrolled.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore.WasEnrolledInUPMWhenBackendWasCreated
histogram.summary: Recorded on Android when the password store backend is created. This happens on startup and once per profile. It logs whether the user is enrolled in UPM. In this context, all profiles are enrolled unless they have encountered an unrecoverable error upon querying GMS Core. Once that happens, a profile pref is flipped and the client is considered unenrolled from that point on.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.APIError.{SyncErrorStatus}
histogram.summary: The error codes returned by the GMS Core ChromeSync 1P API when {SyncErrorStatus} is returned by SyncService.GetAuthError(). Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.ClearAllLocalPasswords.LoginsToRemove
histogram.summary: Total number of logins to be removed by ClearAllLocalPasswords.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.ClearAllLocalPasswords.SuccessRate
histogram.summary: Ratio between successfully removed logins and total number of logins in the GMS's local storage. Removal is considered successful when change list is non-empty. Recorded when all the logins have been processed. If total number of logins is 0, nothing is recorded.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.Retry{Operation}.APIError
histogram.summary: Records the last error code returned by the GMS ChromeSync 1P API when scheduling a retry for the {Operation} operation. This is recorded after the asynchronous call comes back with an error and it is checked that operation could be retried. This is only recorded for GMS API errors on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.Retry{Operation}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Records the retry attempt number when the GMS ChromeSync 1P API returned an error and a retry for the {Operation} operation is about to be scheduled. This is recorded after the asynchronous call comes back with an error and it is checked that operation could be retried. This is only recorded for GMS API errors on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend.UptimeOnAPIError{ErrorCode}
histogram.summary: Chrome uptime on recieving {ErrorCode} error from the GMS 1P API. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned with error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend{Function}.APIError
histogram.summary: The error codes returned by the GMS Core ChromeSync 1P API{Function}. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend{Function}.ConnectionResultCode
histogram.summary: The connection result status code returned by the GMS Core ChromeSync 1P API{Function}. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned with error and only if ConnectionResult was set on the returned error.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreAndroidBackend{Function}.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: This metric reports the error observed when {Function} the PasswordStore Android backend. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned.

variant.name: .GetLoginsAsync
variant.summary: retrieving logins filtered by signon realm from

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreInitResult
histogram.summary: Success rate of initialization of password store. Recorded for every user once on the Chrome profile startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreProxyBackend.{Function}.Fallback
histogram.summary: Records true if the fallback to the build-in backend occurred during {Function} execution due to error returned by the GMS Core backend. True is recorded when the Android backend function returned with error and fallback is about to be called. False is never recorded.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreProxyBackend.{Function}.{Metric}.{Measurement}
histogram.summary: Records the number of logins {Metric}{Measurement} Recorded when the asynchronous job for {Function} has returned.

variant.name: Diff
variant.summary: in either the main or the shadow backend but not in both of them

variant.name: InconsistentPasswords
variant.summary: that occur in both the main and the shadow backend but differ in their stored passwords

variant.name: MainMinusShadow
variant.summary: in the main backend that are not in the shadow backend

variant.name: ShadowMinusMain
variant.summary: in the shadow backend that are not the main backend

variant.name: Rel
variant.summary: , divided by the total number of logins, as a percentage rounded up to the next integer. If the denominator is zero, no value is emitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStoreProxyBackend.{ModifyingFunction}.{Metric}.{Measurement}
histogram.summary: Records the number of password store changes {Metric}{Measurement} Recorded when the asynchronous job for {ModifyingFunction} has returned. Recorded only for non-syncing users and only after initial migration is finished.

variant.name: Diff
variant.summary: in either the main or the shadow backend but not in both of them

variant.name: InconsistentPasswords
variant.summary: that occur in both the main and the shadow backend but differ in their stored passwords

variant.name: MainMinusShadow
variant.summary: in the main backend that are not in the shadow backend

variant.name: ShadowMinusMain
variant.summary: in the shadow backend that are not the main backend

variant.name: Rel
variant.summary: , divided by the total number of password store changes, as a percentage rounded up to the next integer. If the denominator is zero, no value is emitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore{Backend}{Function}
histogram.summary: Records each {Function} call by the PasswordStore {Backend}. Recorded twice: 1) when the store issues the request, and 2) as the asynchronous job has finished or times out. The first bucket may exceed others if Chrome closes before the request finishes.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore{Backend}{Function}.Latency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of the asynchronous call to {Function} the PasswordStore {Backend}. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned.

variant.name: .DisableAutoSignInForOriginsAsync
variant.summary: disable autosignin for matching logins in

variant.name: .GetLoginsAsync
variant.summary: retrieve logins filtered by signon realm from

variant.name: .RemoveLoginsByURLAndTimeAsync
variant.summary: remove logins filtered by URL and creation time from

variant.name: .RemoveLoginsCreatedBetweenAsync
variant.summary: remove logins filtered by creation time from

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordStore{Backend}{Function}.Success

variant.name: .AddLoginAsync
variant.summary: AddLoginAsync() succeeded to add a login to

variant.name: .ClearAllLocalPasswords
variant.summary: ClearAllLocalPasswords() successfully obtained a list of all logins from

variant.name: .DisableAutoSignInForOriginsAsync
variant.summary: DisableAutoSignInForOriginsAsync() succeeded in disabling autosignin for matching logins in

variant.name: .FillMatchingLoginsAsync
variant.summary: succeeded in filling matching logins from

variant.name: .GetAllLoginsAsync
variant.summary: GetAllLoginsAsync() succeeded in retrieving all logins from

variant.name: .GetAutofillableLoginsAsync
variant.summary: GetAutofillableLoginsAsync() succeeded in retrieving autofillable logins from

variant.name: .GetLoginsAsync
variant.summary: succeeded in retrieving logins filtered by signon realm from

variant.name: .RemoveLoginAsync
variant.summary: RemoveLoginAsync() succeeded in removing a login from

variant.name: .RemoveLoginsByURLAndTimeAsync
variant.summary: RemoveLoginsByURLAndTimeAsync() succeeded in removing logins filtered by URL and creation time from

variant.name: .RemoveLoginsCreatedBetweenAsync
variant.summary: RemoveLoginsCreatedBetweenAsync() succeeded in removing logins filtered by creation time from

variant.name: .UpdateLoginAsync
variant.summary: UpdateLoginAsync() succeeded in updating a login in

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSyncState2
histogram.summary: Whether the passwords are syncing and, if not, then what's causing sync failures. Recorded after the first sync attempt either succeeds or fails.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordViewPage.UserActions
histogram.summary: Records the user actions performed on password viewing page in desktop settings. Reported upon interactions with the password settings page.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PrefilledUsernameFillOutcome
histogram.summary: Records successful fills of prefilled username values known as placeholders and unsuccessful fills that were blocked because the prefilled value was not identified as a placeholder. Recorded once per PasswordAutofillAgent instance, when attempting to fill a password form that contains a username value which was prepopulated by the website.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ProvisionalSaveFailure
histogram.summary: Breakdown of cases where a password is submitted, but we don't even try and save it. Recorded for every password form submit.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ReauthToAccessPasswordInSettings
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user interacts with reauthentication in order to access the passwords in settings, or when such reauthentication is skipped for a well-defined reason.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.RequirementsSpecFetcher.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response code of fetching a password requirements file.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.RequirementsSpecFetcher.NetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code of fetching a password requirements file.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.RequirementsSpecFetcher.NetworkDuration
histogram.summary: Time until the lookup for a password requirements file completed (or was aborted).

histogram.name: PasswordManager.RequirementsSpecFetcher.Result
histogram.summary: Result of fetching requirements for password during password generation.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ReusedPasswordType
histogram.summary: Records the type of password (e.g saved password, sync password, enterprise password etc) reused by the user. This is logged when a password reuse happens.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavedGaiaPasswordHashCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of Gaia password hashes that have been saved for password reuse detection. This is logged during the initialization of the PasswordReuseManagerImpl class.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavedPasswordsCapabilitiesFetcher.AllOriginsResponseTime
histogram.summary: Response time for fetching password change capabilities for all stored passwords urls. It is also recorded if the fetch fails.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavedPasswordsCapabilitiesFetcher.CacheState
histogram.summary: PasswordScriptsFetcher's cache state when the fetcher is asked to refresh scripts if necessary.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavedPasswordsCapabilitiesFetcher.SingleOriginResponseTime
histogram.summary: Response time for fetching password change capabilities for a single domain. It is also recorded if the fetch fails.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SaveUIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the save password UI (bubble or infobar) closed?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SaveUIDismissalReasonAfterUnblacklisting
histogram.summary: Why was the save password UI (bubble or infobar) closed? This is currently recorded only for Android and only after the user has unblacklisted an origin for saving from the accessory sheet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SaveUIOnClearedPasswordChangeFormDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the save password UI closed on a cleared change password form? Recorded when the save bubble/infobar is dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SaveUpdateUIDismissalReasonAndroid{Dialog}
histogram.summary: When Chrome detects an unknown password being entered into a web page, it shows the message asking if user wants to save or update (if there is already some other password saved for the site) the password. This histogram records what user decides to do with the message. Possible outcomes are: to accept Chrome's offer to save/update the password, to dismiss the message, to save/update the password in the edit dialog (which can be navigated from the message), to cancel in the dialog, tell to never save password for the site. Records the user action when the message is dismissed as well as when the dialog opened from the message is dismissed.

variant.name: .Update
variant.summary: Only Update password dialog values (for only 1 password saved previously per site)

variant.name: .UpdateWithUsernameConfirmation
variant.summary: Only Update password dialog values when user must confirm the username (multiple passwords saved per site)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavingOnUsernameFirstFlow
histogram.summary: Records user actions when Chrome offers to save a username on a page which is considered to be a username first flow. Recorded on a successful submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Settings.ToggleAutoSignIn
histogram.summary: Records user action to enable or disable automatic sign-in in password settings. Recorded when user interacts with the toggle. This metric is only logged on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Settings.ToggleOfferToSavePasswords
histogram.summary: Records user action to enable or disable password saving in password settings. Recorded when user interacts with the toggle. This metric is only logged on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StoreDecryptionResult
histogram.summary: Describes the result of decrypting a password value from the LoginDatabase.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StoresUsedForFillingInLast28Days
histogram.summary: Which of the password manager's stores (the profile-scoped one and/or the account-scoped one) were used within the last 28 days for filling passwords. Recorded whenever a password form is successfully submitted. This should typically only be used with "Count unique clients".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StoresUsedForFillingInLast7Days
histogram.summary: Which of the password manager's stores (the profile-scoped one and/or the account-scoped one) were used within the last 7 days for filling passwords. Recorded whenever a password form is successfully submitted. This should typically only be used with "Count unique clients".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmittedFormFrame2
histogram.summary: Records a frame type (eg. main frame, iframe with the same url as the main frame, etc) of a submitted password form. Logged only once per submitted form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmittedFormType
histogram.summary: The type (e.g. signup, login, change password) of all submitted password forms. This is logged on form submission, but doesn't require that the password manager saves.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuccessfulLoginHappened
histogram.summary: For a successful login, whether the origin is HTTPS or HTTP. A succesful login is detected by local heuristics. The heuristics can misclassify whether a login succeeded, so this is an approximation.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuccessfulSubmissionIndicatorEvent
histogram.summary: The type of event that the Password Manager used for detecting a password form submission. Recorded for each successful password form submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncControllerDelegateNotifiesCredentialManager.APIErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error codes returned by the GMS Core ChromeSync 1P CredentialManager API for setting the current autofill account. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncControllerDelegateNotifiesCredentialManager.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error code registered when PasswordSyncControllerDelegateAndroid fails in notifying CredentialManager of the currect account. This happens either when the request made to the credential manager API returns with a failure or before, if the PasswordSyncControllerDelegateAndroid makes a call with incomplete data (e.g. no account is found when one is required).

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncControllerDelegateNotifiesCredentialManager.Success
histogram.summary: Whether PasswordSyncControllerDelegateAndroid succeeded in notifying CredentialManager of the currect account. Recorded when the async request to notify the credential manager about the account returns.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncingAccountState2
histogram.summary: Information about the user's current sync status crossed with whether their synced password is saved. Recorded once per Chrome profile at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncMetadataReadError
histogram.summary: This metric reports the error observed when trying to read the Sync metadata from the password store during the start of Password sync.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncPasswordHashChange
histogram.summary: This metric reports a type of a sync password hash change event. Recorded when a sync password hash is saved or cleared.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimeBetweenStoreAndServer
histogram.summary: The time between receiving saved credentials from the password store and predictions from the Autofill server. Recorded each time when predictions for a form are received.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.CredentialIndex
histogram.summary: The index of a selected credential in the Touch To Fill sheet. Only recorded when the sheet showed at least two entries.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.DismissalReason
histogram.summary: The reason why a user dismissed the Touch To Fill sheet. Recorded once for each dismissal.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.NumCredentialsShown
histogram.summary: The number of credentials shown in the Touch To Fill sheet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.Outcome
histogram.summary: The final outcome that closes the Touch To Fill sheet (e.g. credentials filling, settings opened, failed reauth, sheet dismissal). Recorded once for each closing.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.SubmissionReadiness
histogram.summary: A given form's state (e.g. there are empty fields in the form, or there are only two fields and they both are filled by Chrome) that indicates whether the form is ready for submission. Recorded when a Touch To Fill sheet is shown for that form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.SuccessfulSubmissionWasObserved
histogram.summary: Measures whether a credential filling by Touch To Fill leads to a successful submission or not (submission failed, or the submission could not be associated with filling by Touch To Fill). A submission after filling is considered successful iff the filled and submitted usernames coincide, the timestamps are within one minute and a user hasn't modified any field after filling. Otherwise, it is reported as 'no successful submission observed'. The metric is used to compare a login success rate when automated submission is enabled and disabled. Due to stale or wrong credentials, the success rate will be degraded independently of automated submission. Recorded when the password manager has classified a login submission (succeeded or failed) or a user has modified a field after Touch-To-Fill.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.TimeToSuccessfulLogin
histogram.summary: The time in milliseconds between filling by the Touch To Fill and a successful submission (To ensure filling and submitting correspond to each other, the usernames should coincide and the timestamps should be within one minute. A successful login after a failed submission or manual typing is not reported). Used to compare the times when automated submission is enabled and disabled. Thus, we measure the time saved for a user. Recorded when the password manager detects that the login was successful.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TouchToFill.UserAction
histogram.summary: The action a user took when interacting with the Touch To Fill sheet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the password manager's UI (bubble or infobar) closed? Save and update UI are tracked separately.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UnenrolledFromUPMDueToErrors
histogram.summary: Records true when a client's profile is being unenrolled from UPM. This happens when a password store request to GMS Core fails with an error that is deemed unrecoverable.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.ActiveStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded on startup after the sync service is initialized and once per profile. It is recorded for clients that have UPM enabled and logs whether UPM is actually active for them. Reasons why UPM might be inactive are: passwords sync off or client unenrolled due to unresolvable errors. Note a client can have both sync off and be unenrolled, in which case it will still only appear in the sync off bucket, since this is considered the main reason why the client is inactive for UPM.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.WasMigrationDone
histogram.summary: Records whether passwords were successfully migrated from built in backed to android backed and the current migration version stored in pref is greater/equal to the version from feature parameters. Recorded on start up.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.{UPMMigrationType}.Latency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of {UPMMigrationType}. Recorded when all operations are completed and migration is finished.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.{UPMMigrationType}.Success
histogram.summary: Records success of {UPMMigrationType}. Recorded when the migration is finished.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UpdateUIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the update password UI (bubble or infobar) closed?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UpdateUIOnClearedPasswordChangeFormDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the update password UI closed on a cleared change password form? Recorded when the update bubble/infobar is dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UPMUnenrollmentReason
histogram.summary: Records the error code returned by the GMS Password Checkup 1P API which caused unenrollment. This is recorded when the user is evicted from UPM.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UPMUpdateSignInCredentialsSucces
histogram.summary: Records whether the user was successfully signed in after using the sign in button on the Password Manager error message. The outcome can be either success or failure. It's recorded when the sign in flow that updates credentials finishes. Currently only used on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UsernameDetectionMethod
histogram.summary: Measures what method was used for username field detection in the renderer code. The metric may be recorded several times for page visit because it is recorded at every PasswordForm creation. If a site changes HTML attributes of fields or server-side predictions is received, different values can be recorded for the same form. If an outcome of HTML classifier or a server-side prediction coincides with the outcome of base heuristic, the metric points to base heuristic method.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.WeakCheck.CheckedPasswords
histogram.summary: The number of passwords analyzed during the passwords weak check.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.WeakCheck.PasswordScore
histogram.summary: The score of the password that was checked by the passwords weak check. The score indicates how guessable the password is.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.WeakCheck.Time
histogram.summary: The time it took to complete the passwords weak check.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.WeakCheck.WeakPasswords
histogram.summary: The number of weak passwords found when the passwords weak check completed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.WellKnownChangePasswordResult
histogram.summary: The type of change password URL opened after requesting, for example, https://example.com/.well-known/change-password. The metric is emitted when the appropriate throttle handles such URLs.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Location}.AuthenticationResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to re-auth the user via biometrics when {Location}.

variant.name: BiometricAuthenticationPromo
variant.summary: trying to enable the feature from the promo dialog

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Location}.AuthenticationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes user to authenticate {Location}.

variant.name: PasswordFilling
variant.summary: on webpage after selecting a suggestion to fill

variant.name: Settings
variant.summary: in settings when trying to show/copy/edit/export passwords

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}BlacklistedSitesHiRes2{CustomPassphraseStatus}
histogram.summary: The total number of sites that the user has blocklisted in the password manager's {Store}. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per Chrome profile and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}InaccessiblePasswords
histogram.summary: The number of saved passwords that could not be decrypted in the password manager's {Store}. Recorded once for the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}PasswordNotes.CountCredentialsWithNonEmptyNotes
histogram.summary: Total number of credentials with non-empty notes in the password manager's {Store}. Recorded once per Chrome profile and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}PasswordNotes.CountNotesPerCredential
histogram.summary: Total number of notes attached to a password in the password manager's {Store}. Recorded once for each credential in a Chrome profile and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}TimesPasswordUsed2.{PasswordType}{CustomPassphraseStatus}
histogram.summary: The number of times each saved password from the {Store} has been used to log in. Split by whether created by the user or generated by Chrome, and further by whether the user used sync with custom passphrase or not. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per Chrome profile, soon after startup, and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}TotalAccountsHiRes2.WithScheme{Scheme}
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in the password manager's {Store} (across all sites) for origins with the scheme (e.g., HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) as given in the histogram suffix. For each scheme, the count is recorded once per Chrome profile and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.{Store}{Metric2}.{PasswordType}{CustomPassphraseStatus}
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored {Metric2} in the password manager's {Store}. , split by whether created by the user or generated by Chrome, and further by whether the user use sync with custom passphrase or not. Recorded during browser start-up, once per Chrome profile and at most once per day.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.InterstitialAction
histogram.summary: Records how a user interacts with the password protection interstitial (a.k.a chrome://reset-password page). Logged when the interstitial is shown and when the user chooses to change their password. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-01-30 to 2021-10-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.ModalWarningDialogAction
histogram.summary: Records how a user interacts with the password protection modal warning dialog. Logged when the dialog is shown and when the user chooses to change their password, ignore warning, or navigate away.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.ModalWarningDialogLifetime
histogram.summary: Records the interval between when the password protection modal warning dialog is constructed and when the dialog is destructed. The dialog can be destructed when the user takes action or the web content is destroyed.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PageInfoAction
histogram.summary: Records how a user interacts with page info bubble that displays the password protection warning. Logged when such page info bubble is shown and when the user chooses to change their password, ignore warning, or mark site as legitimate via buttons on the page info bubble.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordAlertModeOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the password alert mode, indicating if password alert warning is shown successfully or if it is skipped for some reason. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-01-30 to 2021-10-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordProtectionResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary:
Response or error codes for PasswordProtectionRequest. Logged after chrome receives response of PasswordProtectionRequest from Safe Browsing service.
Note: In M98 the error code HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE was changed to log the actual HTTP response code.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordReuseSyncAccountType
PasswordProtection.RequestNetworkDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for PasswordProtectionService request. It is not recorded for requests that were canceled.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the password protection request, indicating if request is sent out successfully or if it is skipped or canceled for some reason.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.RequestReferringAppSource
histogram.summary: Records the referring app source of the password protection request, indicating the source of the referring app name in the request. This metric is only logged on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.RequestWithToken.{TriggerType}
histogram.summary: Records if the password protection request, triggered by a(n) {TriggerType}, was sent with a GAIA-tied OAuth2 token. This token is sent only for signed-in Enhanced Safe Browsing users.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.SampleReportSent
histogram.summary: Logs when an event where users reuse their password or focus on a password field is sent as a sample ping when the URL in the allowlist to Safe Browsing. Events only happen 1% of the time when URLs match the allowlist.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.Verdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for a password protection request. Request can be triggered when user focuses on a password field or enters a protected password (syncing, signed-in, or saved).

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.VisualFeatureExtractionDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes to extract the visual features of a login page before sending a PasswordProtectionRequest. Logged every time visual features are extracted (when an SBER user sends an On Focus ping).
